issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: In the [Eucalyptus 3.2 User Console Guide|http://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/3.2/cg/console_install_intro.html#console_install_intro], we make no mention of how to deploy the user console in a high availability deployment.  If this doesn't rely on jgroup membership with the rest of the Eucalyptus components, can we look at deploying the Eucalyptus User Console using a cluster service like RHCS, Pacemaker/Corosync, etc.?
fields.summary: Scaling the User Console and having a highly available access to the cloud

comments.body: I am willing to assist in this as well.  Please let me know if there are any questions.
Perhaps we should consider supporting a load balanced configuration for the console.

Let's use this bug to track the question of: What should happen when/if a user connects to the User console of a secondary clc.  Do we expect bad things to happen?  Should we look to alert the user or prevent this action?
Confirming so this hits the eng bug scrub
[~decker] to talk with [~hspencer] and get the details to turn this into a documentation task
this is about having many users of a cloud and how we deploy the proxy to handle large numbers console users.
[~dkavanagh], can you talk to [~hspencer] and propose some content we can use for documenting this?
Curious on how we are progressing on this issue. Can somebody throw more light? Thanks.

Hey [~shashi],

There has been some conversations on the side regarding setting this up and QA'ing it, but there has been no hard deadlines.  

We took note of a couple of URLs to help set up an HA Loadbalancer with Nginx and Keepalived:

* http://www.tornadoweb.org/en/stable/httpserver.html
* http://kaivanov.blogspot.com/2012/11/building-ha-load-balancer-with-nginx.html

Other than that, nothing else has come of it.

Whats the priority of this?

[~hspencer], Did you, [~dkavanagh] / [~decker] get a chance to sync up? Previous comments suggested so. Is this a documentation task only (cc [~smarvin]) or does this involve any new feature request? 

Given the number of users running Eucalyptus in HA configuration, it would be fairly high priority to educate our users on our preferred way to deploy the console in HA config, but I wouldn't mark this as a release blocker (as such documentation will continue to evolve even in between releases, so not sure terms such as "release blocker" even makes sense in this context). Does this make sense?

[~shashi], this is not about using the console with HA (which isn't hard, you point the the proxy to the CLC, and if you're hitting the disabled one it redirects)   

This is about scaling the number of Console Users for a cloud.  i.e. how many consoles per proxy, what happens when a proxy server is unavailable, how many proxy servers can we use, etc...

[~tjcramer], 

Okay. I initially did not read this as a scalability request for the proxy, but more of HA for the proxy itself. [~hspencer]'s recent comments does seem to suggest using of a LB for scaling the # of users. Your edit to the subject makes it more clear. Thanks.

On HA config, I'm unsure if our users make a distinction between HA just for the core components vs. HA for proxy + core components. [~hspencer] / [~graziano] may be able to throw more light on this. Do you think there are reasons why we should make that distinction?

Hey [~shashi],

Yes, I synced with [~dkavanagh] on this. We discussed the links that I shared above.  I am not sure as to the priority on this, so thats why I pinged you to make sure it didn't get missed on your radar.
Why not just load balance with our own ELB implementation ? :S

Hey [~shashi],

As [~tjcramer] mentioned above about the User Console HA, there are different things to consider.  

* Take into account the number of User Consoles that can communicate with the CLC(s)
* Take into account how the User Console(s) are presented to the customer (e.g. should a customer go to different URLs to hit a different console, or should they go to one URL that is load balanced and made highly available across multiple User Consoles - I think the second option is what users expect).

The information I shared above looked at possible ways to address the second area (and there may be others).  The first area is what hasn't been answered yet about how to do it.  Hope this helps.

[~hspencer], can you translate this into question(s) that you need Engineering to answer? It looks like you are looking for information / documentation / design constraints rather than feature request needing development effort (at least to begin with). Is that right? What's the end goal we are looking for here?
duplicates other issues addressing running the console behind ELB.
